description.en: Śrī Viśvanātha, son of Vaidyabharva of Vedāraṇya, received initiation from sage Jñānānanda, became Śuddhānandamunīśvara was established in Kāñcī; having carried on the responsibilities of the preceptor for eighty-one years, he secured union on the sixth day of the bright fortnight in the year Nala.

shlokas:
vEdAraNyajavaidyabharvutanayaH zrIvizvanAthAbhidhO jJAnAnandamunEravApya niyamaM kAJcIpadE sthApitaH.
zuddhAnandamunIzvaraH sa zaradaH saikAmazItiM dhurAm AcAryasya vahannavApa ca nalajyESThAcchaSaSThyAM layam..13..
—puNyazlOkamaJjarI
